title: Practical Engineering Design Problem-Solving Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic engineering concepts and possession of fundamental job-specific knowledge
context.additional_context: Aims to cultivate systematic problem-solving skills for engineering design challenges faced by current practitioners in real work, with cross-domain transfer learning opportunities through language domain case analysis

learning_goals: Analyzing engineering design problems from actual industrial settings with over 80% accuracy
Independently executing a multi-phase (3+) design process by applying problem-based learning (PBL) methodologies
Completing final design deliverables using collaboration tools in team-based projects and achieving at least 75 points based on evaluation rubric criteria

resources: LMS Platform (Including Discussion Board, Assignment Submission System)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
